title: Full nested folder support
body:
Expose the nested folder support to the user. This does quite a few things to address this:
- Implement a new folder picker that handles browsing available folders. Much of the code
  is borrowed from the already existing BookmarksFragment
- Add rename and move operations for folders and bookmarks
- Expose creating folders in the BookmarksActivity and the new folder picker (even if they're not top
  level!)
- Clean up a lot of how TintBrowser was performing sql queries. It was concatenating the strings manually
  instead of trying to use the ? notation wherever possible.
- Add getting the folder stack for a given folder ID. This allows the folder picker to easily jump to
  the current bookmark/folder's location when the user wants to move it.
- Drawables, since there weren't any for adding folders nor smaller ones for the folder picker UI

title: Violation of "view holder" patttern
Slow operations in UI thread
body:
Dear developers,

I am analyzing Tint using a static code checker. I found some potential slow operations in Tint's UI thread.

Android documentation says this: 
http://developer.android.com/training/articles/perf-anr.html

"Any method that runs in the UI thread should do as little work as possible on that thread. In particular, activities should do as little as possible in key life-cycle methods such as onCreate(). Potentially long running operations such as network or database operations should be done in a worker thread (e.g., via AsyncTask)."

I found the following event handlers transitively performing heavy operations:

org.tint.ui.activities.TintBrowserActivity.onCreate() which call File IO operations.

The call hierarchy is shown below:
org.tint.utils.ApplicationUtils.getStringFromRawResource()
org.tint.ui.components.CustomWebView.loadUrl()
org.tint.ui.managers.BaseUIManager.loadUrl()
org.tint.ui.managers.BaseUIManager.loadUrl()
org.tint.ui.activities.TintBrowserActivity.restoreTabs()
org.tint.ui.activities.TintBrowserActivity.onCreate()

Do you think these operations affect Tint's performance? If yes, perhaps moving these actions to a separate thread can help make Tint super smooth in user interaction. Looking forward to your reply and hope I can help improve Tint.

title: Performance improvement suggestion
body:
Dear developers,

I am a big fan of TintBrowser, and recently I am writing a static code analysis tool to conduct performance analysis for Android apps. I found several violations of "resource leakage" patterns in TintBrowser's code. These violations could affect the performance of your app. Here is a representative one.

In org.tint.providers package, the method public static void deleteFolder(ContentResolver contentResolver, long id) invokes "acquireContentProviderClient" to acquire a content provider client. However, according to the suggestion of anroid developer, the caller must indicate that they are done with the provider by calling release() which will allow the system to release the provider it it determines that there is no other reason for keeping it active. Unfortunately, this principle is not correctly applied in this method.

So I am curious :) Looking forward to your response. Thanks.

References: 
resource leakage pattern: http://developer.android.com/reference/android/content/ContentResolver.html#acquireContentProviderClient(android.net.Uri)

title: Fix #37 (empty URL caused a bad SQLite request)
body:
bushrang3r's (#37) example case uses a pop-up to show a calendar, but Tint doesn't keep the base URL -- this is probably not the expected behavior, but that's another issue (to be opened maybe).
Empty URL (and originalURL) caused the SQL query to be `url =  OR url =`, therefore an invalid query.
If both URL and originalURL are empty, the fuctions returns immediately, and "protection" was added to keep the query valid if only one of the two strings are OK.

If it isn't too much of a hassle, could you please add a pie control like in the android stock browser 4.0+? It's the most efficient way to use the browser IMO.

By the way, could you reduce the loading bar thickness to 1px? 
Other than that, this browser is quite amazing, but I still prefer the stock browser for being faster and for having the pie control.

title: Feature Request: Option to disable third party cookies
body:
Hi Tint Devs,

I was looking for way to disable third party cookies, but as with most other android browsers, I can only disable or enable all cookies globally, checked with http://www.grc.com/cookies/forensics.htm.
I managed to do it with firefox on android by manually editing the config, but I would prefer to use Tint instead of firefox.

Thanks for developing this alternative browser!

title: Sound of HTML5 videos stay if we close Tint Browser
body:
When I see video on Youtube for example, and close Tint Browser with physical ”back” button, the sound stay and we must wait the video finish or killing Tint Browser cached processes.

Another thing which may be related: the other day I play several time a the sound file on http://fr.m.wiktionary.org/wiki/solennel. Several minutes/hours after, it plays the sound file one other time (when not in the browser).

EDIT: the other day, I play a music here: http://www.theinmutantopera.com/opera.html. When I close the tab (with the toolbar button), the sound continue to play! Hope this help to resolve this (very annoying) problem.

EDIT2: it also happens when closing tab (with software buton, and with others tabs opened) visiting http://trojanhorse.bandcamp.com/. Very annoying to kill browser, and loose all my tabs just for that!

title: Trouble adding new search engine
body:
I lTryike the browser.  I've been trying it on my Galaxy pad 10.1, v1, running ICS. 

However, I haven't had any luck trying to set Google UK as my default search engine. If I set its web address (www.google.co.uk) in the 'other' category it comes up with page not found when I try to do a search! It seems to need a string after the address, which is a pain to have to put in manually. 

Can you make it simpler to add new search engines?
